meanings.definition: Having a tendency to tip over or fall
meanings.sent2: Be careful on the tippy stool.
meanings.sent3: The tippy table made everyone nervous during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The tippy boat rocked gently on the water.
meanings.sent5: The tippy tower of blocks collapsed with a crash.

meanings.definition: The top or highest point of something
meanings.sent1: The climber reached the tippy peak of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The tippy of the tree swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The cat perched on the tippy of the fence.
meanings.sent4: The tippy of the rollercoaster offered a thrilling view.
meanings.sent5: The tippy of the flagpole fluttered in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: She tippy the vase to pour the water out.
meanings.sent2: The boat began to tippy in the rough waves.
meanings.sent3: He tippy the bookshelf to look behind it.
meanings.sent4: The wind caused the tree to tippy back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The dancer tippy gracefully across the stage.
